articles.title: Is China losing control of the coronavirus outbreak?
articles.description: Some Communist Party leaders have been sacked as the number of confirmed cases rises.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Egypt confirms coronavirus case, the first in Africa
articles.description: The country's health ministry says the affected person is a 'foreigner' who is hospitalised and in isolation.
articles.content:
Egypt has confirmed its first case of a deadly coronavirus that emerged in central China at the end of last year and has since spread to more than two dozen countries around the world.
Health Ministry spokesman Khaled Mugahed said in a statement on Friday th… [+1181 chars]

articles.author: Omar Suleiman
articles.title: Don't forget the Uighur amid the Coronavirus crisis
articles.description: The world has been indifferent to the plight of the Uighurs, leading some to claim that coronavirus may be a punishment.
articles.content: When a people are subjected to the most unimaginable forms of cruelty at the hands of a brutal regime and prominent world powers are unwilling to take any meaningful steps to stop that cruelty, where and what do they then turn to? When a tragedy strikes the g… [+8166 chars]

articles.author: Katrina Yu
articles.title: China: Millions of people quarantined to check coronavirus spread
articles.description: The Chinese city of Wuhan has been under lockdown for three weeks since it was identified as the source of the outbreak.
articles.content:
Millions of people have been ordered to stay at home as the Chinese government tries to stop the spread of the virus.
Journalists are restricted from travelling there, but Al Jazeera obtained exclusive pictures from one of the residents trapped there.
Al Ja… [+46 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Analysis: Are coronavirus figures from China credible?
articles.description: Coronavirus has killed at least 1,380 people with nearly all deaths in mainland China.
articles.content:
Coronavirus has killed at least 1,380 people with nearly all deaths in mainland China.
At least 25 countries have confirmed cases and several nations have evacuated their citizens from Hubei province.
Three deaths have been recorded outside mainland China, … [+184 chars]

articles.author: Wayne Hay
articles.title: Cruise ship passengers in Cambodia clear of coronavirus
articles.description: Blood tests taken from some passengers, who were unwell when ship arrived in Cambodian waters on Thursday, tested negative.
articles.content:
In Cambodia, it was all smiles as passengers disembarked from a cruise ship that had been turned away by four Asian governments over fears of an outbreak of the coronavirus.
There have been no confirmed cases among the more than 2,000 people on board the MS … [+95 chars]

articles.title: China's tough choices: Contain the virus or support the economy? - Aljazeera.com

articles.content: Sichuan, China: Fighting a war on two fronts is never easy. But that is the situation facing China's government: It is trying to contain the country's worst viral epidemic in 17 years, while also attempting to prevent its enormous economy from suffering a pai… [+9771 chars]

articles.author: Violet Law
articles.title: Coronavirus outbreak maroons dream vacations of thousands
articles.description: Nearly 1,500 passengers on board MS Westerdam allowed to disembark in Cambodia after five countries deny the ship entry.
articles.content:
Hong Kong - The fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak has upended the dream vacations at sea for thousands of passengers.
The 2,257 passengers and crew abroad MS Westerdam heaved a sigh of relief when they finally saw land from their cabin windows and set afoo… [+5263 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: New fatalities in Hubei push nationwide death toll to 1,483 and further 4,823 cases take total infections near 65,000.
articles.content:
China on Friday reported 116 more deaths in Hubei, the province at the centre of the escalating coronavirus outbreak, bringing to at least 1,483 the total number of deaths across the country.
The province and its capital Wuhan, where the infection now known … [+4453 chars]
